400 hrs on Battlenet

Blizzard has broken almost every promise they have ever made for Overwatch. Plagued by a total lack of innovation, the game has dealt with the same core issues since its launch in 2016. Not to mention the regular under-delivering on its most basic features, complete disregard for its player base, and abandoning the only thing that could bring back real interest in Overwatch, all for the sake of short-term profit.

Steam doesn't allow you to add a review unless you played it for at least 5 minutes(I think). Opened the game, connected to blizzard, got the achievements, and then dipped. Sad that a 71.93 billion dollar company cant put time, resources, and effort into skill trees so that players can play characters they know and love in cool , customized ways. But hey at least we get a battle pass and some new skins. Funniest part is they WAITED to tell people that they wernt giving us the PVE mode they advertised after the fact that the game came out. Such a sad ending to what WAS a iconic game. RIP

This company doesn't what you think about the game or if you even continue to play it. They just want you to install the game, buy the skins, and uninstall. they take forever to update and patch game breaking bugs and don't care if there is a character that is completely overpowering all the others they will fix it when they fix it and your the one who has to deal with it. Many times they will patch things like quick play back fill issues then when you get into a game and someone leaves there will be no back fill. They fix ranked queue so that you will be more equally matched then your fighting grand masters in a plat qp lobby. The company needs to stop trying to farm the player base for money and start listening to them, at least a little.
